newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile puts Argentine mining accords into effect.
newsitem.headline: Chile puts Argentine mining accords into effect.

text.p: Chile formally put into effect two protocols with Argentina to allow two mining projects, El Pachon and Pascua Lama, to operate across the countries' Andean border, according to a decree.
Published in the official gazette, the decree gives the full terms of the protocols signed in March and formally implements them.
The protocols are officially considered the 19th and 20th addenda to a bilateral treaty on economic cooperation, signed by the governments of both countries in 1991.
The protocols give the green light to the El Pachon copper project, owned 50 percent by Canada's Cambior Inc, and Pascua Lama gold prospect, being explored by Barrick Gold Corp.
